body:
What are the concrete use cases that Go's APIs make difficult?

We already support changing the root CAs with tls.Config.RootCAs.

The http Client already provides a DialTLS hook letting you do your own verification there.

The tls Config already provides InsecureSkipVerify to let it get out of the way and let you do your own verifications before using the connection.

I don't see how adding more mechanism enables anything new, and only serves to confuse the readers of documentation about the N different ways to do things.
